name: Potassium Chloride
indications: Potassium chloride extended-release tablets are indicated for the treatment and prophylaxis of hypokalemia with or without metabolic alkalosis, in patients for whom dietary management with potassium-rich foods or diuretic dose reduction is insufficient.
contraindications: Monitor serum potassium and adjust dosages accordingly (2.1) If serum potassium is less than 2.5 mEq/L, use intravenous potassium instead of oral supplementation (2.1) Take with meals and with a glass of water or other liquid. Swallow tablets whole without crushing, chewing or sucking. (2.1) Treatment of hypokalemia : Doses range from 40 to 100 mEq/day in divided doses. Limit doses to 40 mEq per dose. (2.2) Prevention of hypokalemia : Typical dose is 20 mEq per day. (2.2)
warningsAndPrecautions:
Potassium Chloride Extended-Release Tablets USP contains 600 mg or 750 mg of potassium chloride equivalent to 8 mEq and 10 mEq respectively. Potassium chloride is provided as extended-release tablets.
                  Potassium Chloride Extended-Release Tablets USP 750 mg (10 mEq) are white to off-white, circular, film-coated biconvex tablet debossed with “N 32” on one side and plain on other side.
                  NDC: 70518-2964-00
                  NDC: 70518-2964-01
                  NDC: 70518-2964-02
                  NDC: 70518-2964-03
                  NDC: 70518-2964-04
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 90 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 100 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 90 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC 
                  
                  
                  Store at 20o to 25oC (68o to 77oF) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Protect from light and moisture.
                  Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container with a child-resistant closure.
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: Potassium chloride is contraindicated in patients on triamterene and amiloride.
